alert.note: Alert for Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:22PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Judith Basin and south central Fergus Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 222 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Moore, or 21 miles southwest of Lewistown, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewistown, Moore, Glengarry and Buffalo. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 64 and 81. Highway 191 between mile markers 1 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
